chapters.title: Chapter 29: A Terrible Feeling
chapters.info: Tham Felmley, p. 460—A reputable brickmason from Caemlyn. He was accused of murdering his brother in the early days of Morgase's reign. Morgase judged the case herself, and had him hanged. One of his workers actually did it; he confessed to it two years later, laughing at Morgase as he hanged. The real murdered was a witness against Tham at his trial. Morgase clearly still holds his case as one of her greatest legal failures.
